definition: to dry in the air/(fig.) to cold-shoulder
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)

sentences.english: The straw mattress needs to be aired.
The straw mattress needs to be aired.
Allow your loaf to cool completely on a rack, about 2 hours, before slicing.
sentences.chinese: 麪包置晾在鋼架上2小時，完全涼透才切片。

sentences.english: Should notice to burn a bag to want heat preservation on the technology, temperature is even, when air is wrapped, want ventilated.
sentences.chinese: 技術上應注重燒包要保溫，溫度均勻，晾包時要通風。

sentences.english: I have got one or two shirts to hang out.
sentences.chinese: 我有一兩件衣服要掛出去晾。

sentences.english: Let the water cool before you drink it.
Let the water cool before you drink it.
It's a lovely, windy day. Help me to peg out the washing.
sentences.chinese: 天氣真好，又有風，請把我洗好的衣服晾出去。

sentences.english: Yes， I can hang the washing out.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我能把洗好的衣服晾出去。

sentences.english: Your clothes are airing on the tree.
The clothes are on Mrs Green's clothes line.
sentences.chinese: 衣服都晾在格林夫人的曬衣繩上。

sentences.english: Mother pegs wet clothes on the line.
sentences.chinese: 母親把溼衣服晾在繩上用衣夾夾好。

sentences.english: The sheets were aired on the line.
Put the clothes into a dryer, then hang them in a heated room, they will soon dry.
sentences.chinese: 甩幹後，再晾在有暖氣的房間裏，很快就能幹。

sentences.english: No, you can't leave me hangin' like that, tell me what happened.
sentences.chinese: 不，你不能把我晾在這裏，告訴我發生了什麼事吧。

sentences.english: No, I can't hang the washing out.
sentences.chinese: 不，我不能把洗好的衣服晾出去。

definition: to lay sth out to dry
(of the sun) to scorch/to expose to a scorching sun
to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast
cold water/unboiled water/fig. not yet ready (of plans)
